channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Trump embraces his gray hair amid the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: President Donald Trump's hair looked markedly different Tuesday compared to the famed blonde hairdo he spotted up until the start of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: McDonald's will slash prices on Big Macs, Chicken McNuggets and Happy Meals from TODAY
item.description: Chicken McNuggets, Happy Meals and the Quarter Pounder with Cheese are set to come down in price across Britain after Rishi Sunak slashed VAT from 20 per cent to 5 per cent.

item.title: Decapitated and dismembered body of a man, 33, is found in luxury Manhattan apartment block
item.description: The victim has been identified as Fahim Saleh, a millionaire tech entrepreneur who moved into his $2 million Lower East Side apartment late last year.

item.title: Scottish barber reopens at midnight as pubs, cinemas and attractions welcome customers
item.description: Hotels, barber shops, tourist attractions and pubs are reopening in Scotland today after months of lockdown. First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said this was the 'highest risk' easing of measures.

item.title: Pregnant Russian influencer, 35, marries 20-year-old stepson
item.description: A Russian influencer has married her 20-year-old stepson after divorcing his father, and has announced they are expecting their first baby.

item.title: WhatsApp experiences global outage with thousands affected
item.description: WhatsApp went down for users across the world on Tuesday, leaving them who are unable to connect to the platform, along with sending or receiving messages and logging in.

item.title: Donald Trump suggests HE convinced Boris Johnson to ban 'unsafe' Huawei
item.description: The US President has welcomed Boris Johnson's call to enforce a partial ban on the Chinese telecoms giant and begin ripping out its technology.

item.title: The best love match for YOUR star sign: Astrologer reveals the most compatible combinations
item.description: UK-based astrologer Francesca Oddie revealed the best combinations of star signs if you want to build a happy home with your friend, lover, family or flatmate.

item.title: Teenage girl stuck in BABY SWING freed by firefighters
item.description: Layani Maclean, 14, covered her face as the firefighters arrived to save her in Faringdon, Oxfordshire. Her mother and neighbour can be heard stifling giggles in the background.

item.title: Inflation edges up to 0.6 per cent as summer clothes sales fail to materialise
item.description: Official figures showed the annual CPI measure was up from 0.5 per cent to 0.6 per cent last month. Falls in the price of vegetables offset other rises to keep the change relatively small.

item.title: Kanye West 'bows out of presidential race' after exploring getting his name on Florida ballot
item.description: Rapper Kanye West, 43, has allegedly ended his bid to win the White House after ten days following attempts to get himself on the ballot as a third-party candidate in Florida and several other states.

item.title: West Ham star Michail Antonio appeals for help after cyclist on CCTV appears to slash at tyres
item.description: West Ham's star striker Michail Antonio, 30, took to Instagram tonight to warn others to 'watch-out' after his vehicle was targeted in Wapping, East London.

item.title: Three-year-old boy is left temporarily 'paralysed' after he was bitten by an ADDER
item.description: Lewis Wise was attacked by a venomous adder at Lightwater Country park in Surrey on Sunday.

item.title: Shopper 'left with painful blisters after wearing £15 PrettyLittleThing top'
item.description: Adara Graham, 19, from Cleethorpes, Lincolnshire says she needed 'medical attention' after the metal loops on the garment apparently gave her sore red blisters.

item.title: A gender clinic has agreed to help this boy even though he admits he may still change his mind
item.description: Although you could never tell from his photo, Dexter was born a girl, called Talia. At age two, he became convinced he was a boy; at five, he started living as one.

item.title: Beware 'bedroom traders' boasting of fortunes made from currency bets
item.description: Influencers such as Connor Walsh, 25, (pictured) post pictures of sports cars, pricey homes and luxury holidays, which they claim to have bought with cash earned from trading foreign currency.

item.title: Dr ELIZA FILBY: Not going back to the office will be ruinous for Britain but it's even worse for YOU
item.description: DR ELIZA FILBY: When the Government imposed a three-day working week during the 1973 oil crisis, it feared a productivity drop of at least 40 per cent.

item.title: Personal trainer Sophie Allen reveals the tips everyone losing weight needs to know
item.description: An Australian personal trainer has revealed the 'fat loss basics' everyone trying to lose weight needs to know. Sophie Allen, 30, from Sydney, said there are nine things she swears by for rapid results.

item.title: Holly Branson reveals she 'dressed and peed like a boy' until she was 11'
item.description: Holly Branson has revealed she dressed, peed and 'played' like a boy for almost a decade as a young child, as she thanked her parents for their unconditional love.

item.title: Good Samaritan offers to pay for NHS worker's damaged car
item.description: NHS worker Becky Jones has praised an anonymous man who offered to pay for damage to her car after it was broken into in Nottingham on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: BLM supporters post hateful messages on Facebook of mom shot dead after saying 'all lives matter'
item.description: Jessica Doty Whitaker, 24, was killed early on the morning of July 5, moments after she and her friends got into an argument with Black Lives Matter supporters in a park in Indianapolis.

item.title: Mum wows the internet with her 'brilliant' trick for reaching hard to reach areas while vacuuming
item.description: An Australian mum has revealed how she uses a bunch of straws to vacuum hard to reach areas around her home. She ties the straws using a rubber band and places it in the nozzle of the vacuum.

item.title: Rishi Sunak orders capital gains tax review after it emerges he is facing £322billion budget deficit
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak has asked the Office of Tax Simplification to carry out the analysis of the tax, which is a levy on any profit made when selling assets.

item.title: Mum-of-four shares her genius 'tub' trick for ensuring her house is spotless
item.description: An Australian mother-of-four has shared a clever 'tub' system of cleaning that ensures her house is tidy even with three teenagers underfoot.

item.title: Government announces major Huawei U-turn as it bans firm from UK's 5G network
item.description: Ministers today announced Huawei will be banned from the UK's 5G network with all of the firm's technology to be ripped out by 2027.

item.title: Face masks may have to be worn in ALL public places including offices and other workplaces
item.description: Government officials have begun discussions with large employers in order to try and prevent a much-feared second wave of the deadly pandemic.

item.title: Transport for London REMOVES Banksy's sneezing rats artwork
item.description: TfL confirmed on Tuesday evening that the work was removed 'some days ago' due to a strict anti-graffiti policy.

item.title: Disgusting moment mask-less bus passenger coughs
item.description: The bus passenger was filmed on a service in St Helens, Merseyside on Sunday afternoon. Witnesses said the man was carrying a mask but was refusing to wear it.

item.title: Amber Heard insists she 'DIDN'T defecate on Johnny Depp's bed'
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: The sixth day of Depp's blockbuster libel trial at the High Court saw his housekeeper recall the moment she found a 'large pile of faeces' in the ex-couple's marital bed.

item.title: Google found promoting YouTube videos over competitors like Facebook who host the same content
item.description: Wall Street Journal reports that an investigation that used autonomous bots to search for content found YouTube systemically promotes its own videos over those hosted by competitors like Facebook.

item.title: Naya Rivera's family release statement after tragic death of their 'sassy angel' thanking 'heroine'
item.description: The family was grateful to authorities for their exhaustive search of the area for the better part of a week in their search for the actress.

item.title: Tributes are paid to the mother-of-two found dead in her Solihull flat with fatal neck injuries
item.description: Kerry Woolley was discovered with fatal injuries to her neck at her Solihull flat at 3.20pm, Sunday. A 37-year-old man who was arrested on suspicion of murder at the scene is being questioned.

item.title: Donald Trump wants to expand his Scottish golfing resort
item.description: The famous golfing resort in South Ayrshire, on the west coast of Scotland, is looking at building 225 houses, apartments and villas with new leisure facilities and shops on neighbouring farmland.

item.title: BBC journalists are becoming addicted to 'toxic' Twitter, bosses say
item.description: Some BBC journalists have been disciplined by senior staff over their use of social media websites including Twitter amid complaints they have overstepped the mark online.

item.title: Emmanuel Macron and wife Brigitte are surrounded by anti government protesters chanting 'resign'
item.description: French president Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte were at the centre of an astonishing security scare when furious anti-government swarmed towards them in a Paris park on Tuesday.

item.title: Doctor admits stalking TV explorer Levison wood in a three-month harassment campaign
item.description: Fiza Jabeen, 36, from Harborne in Birmingham, obsessively contacted the former paratrooper on social media despite being handed a restraining order after she contacted his parents and an ex-partner.

item.title: Intruder broke into World's Strongest Man's house
item.description: Eddie Hall, from Newcastle-under-Lyme, was in his hot tub when he noticed the intruder in his garden who challenged 2017's winner of the World's Strongest Man competition to a fight.

item.title: 'Supercar Blondie' Alex Hirschi, 33, makes $2MILLION a year posing with luxury cars on Instagram
item.description: Alex Hirschi left her small town of Boonah, Queensland for the bright lights of Dubai in 2008. She is now the most successful 'carfluencer' in the world, commanding a fee of $45,175 per post.

item.title: Moderna's coronavirus vaccine safely triggers immune response
item.description: Moderna's experimental vaccine for COVID-19 showed it was safe and provoked immune responses in all 45 participants in its phase I trial, the company reported on Tuesday.

item.title: One IS amused: Cheerful Queen laughs after hearing of RAF gunner's lockdown regime of pushing a CAR
item.description: The Queen gave a chuckle after hearing about an RAF gunner's unusual lockdown exercise regime during her second official virtual royal engagement via video call.

item.title: Two people are in critical condition after stabbing spree in Norway
item.description: Police in Sarpsborg, in southern Norway, told people to stay in doors after three people were stabbed in several locations in the town late Tuesday.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: According to Amanda Owen, who has nine children aged 18 to three, mass motherhood is easy. After you reach the fifth, she says, 'it doesn't matter any more'.

item.title: Donald Trump's niece Mary demands he RESIGN in her first interview after publication of memoir
item.description: 'Resign,' Mary Trump responded when ABC News chief anchor George Stephanopoulos asked her what message she would have for her uncle if she were in the Oval Office.

item.title: Katie Price praises 'brave fighter' Harvey and confirms he's still in intensive care
item.description: The glamour model, 42, took to Instagram on Tuesday to thank fans for their support as she gave an update on 'brave fighter' Harvey's condition.

item.title: Ricky Gervais slams 'cancel culture' and defends free speech
item.description: The comedian, 59, has continued to slam 'cancel culture' as he defended the use of free speech in a new interview.

item.title: Meghan Markle urges women to fight inequality with 'compassion'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, spoke to the Girl Up Leadership Summit via Zoom on Tuesday, when she urged young women to tackle inequality in the world.

item.title: The future of airport cleaning? Robots that kill viruses and bacteria are being used at Heathrow
item.description: Ultraviolet (UV) cleaning robots are being deployed at Heathrow as the airport tries to encourage passengers to return to air travel. The machines use UV rays to kill viruses and bacteria at night

item.title: Vernon Kay 'signs up for I'm A Celebrity in £250K deal as show could be moved to Scotland'
item.description: According to reports, the TV and radio presenter, 46, had been approached by ITV bosses to appear on the hit programme for two years, but is finally expected to head to the jungle this autumn.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES sees the Huawei deal go up in smoke
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: From the House of Commons yesterday there came the familiar sound of screeching tyres, followed by rising smoke and the lingering aroma of scorched rubber.

item.title: Shoppers who refuse to wear a face mask can be turned away, ministers reveal
item.description: Ministers are drawing up guidance for shop managers on how to enforce the compulsory wearing of face coverings, which comes into force next week.

item.title: Boris Johnson is urged to channel Winston Churchill and cap care costs for the elderly at £45,000
item.description: Economist Sir Andrew Dilnot, who first proposed a cap nine years ago, said England's creaking social care system is a 'stain on us as a nation', forcing thousands to pay sky-high bills for their care.

item.title: Police officers injured on duty see their pensions under threat
item.description: Disabled and traumatised former officers are being hauled before medical review panels in 'unlawful' attempts to cut their pension packets, campaigners claim.

item.title: Households promised up to £10,000 to make homes more energy-efficient
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is yet to announce full details of the initiative, but experts say work could include loft and wall insulation, double and triple glazing, and eco-friendly heating systems.

item.title: Russian agents may have deliberately left novichok in Salisbury
item.description: The claim was in a legal bid over the inquest of Dawn Sturgess, 44, who died in hospital in Salisbury in July 2018 after coming into contact with novichok contained in a fake perfume bottle.

item.title: More than a million Britons have quit smoking during the coronavirus crisis, analysis suggests
item.description: University College London and Action on Smoking researchers drew on data from a rolling YouGov poll from mid-April, at the height of the outbreak, and late June.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: How wedding day vandals trashed Prince Charles' precious childhood train
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Lady McAlpine is refusing to allow weddings to take place at her sprawling 200-acre estate Fawley Hall near Henley-on-Thames.

item.title: Why the UK should tackled Covid-19 like CUBA did
item.description: Professor John Ashton, a former regional director of public health in the north west England, says the UK's 'dramatic failure' could have been averted by adopting door-to-door testing.

item.title: Donald Trump says 'more white people' being killed by police
item.description: Trump called the killing of George Floyd 'terrible' but bristled as CBS' Catherine Herridge asked him why black people are 'still dying at the hands of law enforcement in this country?'

item.title: Men with higher testosterone levels are MORE generous in the presence of others
item.description: Researchers at the Shenzhen Key Laboratory of Affective and Social Cognitive Science in China studied 140 young men aged between 18 and 25.

item.title: Eighty-four hot dogs is the maximum any human can eat in 10 minutes
item.description: A US-based expert used data from one of Major League Eating's most famous competitions to model just how much food one could potentially 'put away' in one sitting.

item.title: A beer belly reduces a man's chances of becoming a father by almost HALF, new study suggests
item.description: A beer belly reduces a man's chances of becoming a father by almost 50 per cent, a new research study from the Harvard School of Public Health in Boston suggests.

item.title: Paedophile, 54, used public Wi-Fi to download child porn in hospital
item.description: Julie Marshall, 54, was caught after accessing the images from her hospital bed using public Wi-Fi while recovering from a heart attack in August 2017, Preston Crown Court heard.

item.title: German prosecutors preparing to end probe into Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner
item.description: Hans Christian Wolters, the lead prosecutor in the German police's probe into Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner today warned his team had no plans to 'drag out' the investigation.

item.title: World population will start SHRINKING in 44 years after peaking at 9.7bn, study claims
item.description: Researchers at the University of Washington in Seattle said improving access to contraception and better education and employment for women would mean average birth rates tumble.

item.title: About 5,000 heart attack sufferers in England missed out on treatment due to the Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: Researchers analysed NHS hospital data to show that around the peak of the crisis, in late March, admissions were 35 per cent down.

item.title: ASK TONY: Sky charged me £2,597 for TV I didn't watch when I was ill
item.description: In 2017, I cancelled my Sky television and broadband. I was told not to cancel the direct debit because we would owe money during the switchover period.

item.title: Amazon unveils shopping cart that knows what you're buying
item.description: The trollies, called Dash Carts, uses cameras, sensors and a scale to automatically detect what shoppers drop in and then charges their Amazon account automatically when they leave the store.
item.media:description: In a photo provided by Amazon, the company's smart shopping cart is seen in spring 2020 in Los Angeles. The cart, which Amazon unveiled Tuesday, July 14, 2020, uses cameras, sensors and a scale to automatically detect what shoppers drop in. It keeps a tally and then charges their Amazon account when they leave the store. No cashier is needed. (Amazon via AP)

item.title: Nicole Thea and unborn son died after suspected heart attack
item.description: Nicole, who was eight months pregnant with son Reign, passed away at home in Hexborough, Yorkshire, on Saturday morning after complaining about chest and back pains.

item.title: Trump administration abandons policy to deport foreign students
item.description: The Trump administration has abandoned its attempt to force foreign students to leave the US if their colleges hold classes entirely online this fall due to COVID-19.

item.title: Has your star sign been wrong all along
item.description: OSCAR CAINER: as someone who studies astrology, one thing I know is that there are very few constants in our universe. So when stories re-emerged of a 13th star sign, I wasn't shocked.

item.title: Researchers discover cat remains in Poland that could date back to 4,200BC
item.description: Researchers in Poland have discovered the remains of a cat dating between 4,200 and 2,300 BCE, an 'unexpected' discovery suggesting cats spread through Europe earlier than thought.
item.media:credit: Institute of Archeology at Nicolaus Copernicus University

item.title: Hand axe made from a hippopotamus femur was used by early ancestors 1.4 MILLION years ago
item.description: Ancient stone tools have been previously unearthed in Africa, but the latest discovery of a hand axe was formed from a hippopotamus femur 1.4 million years ago -making it the oldest of its kind.

item.title: Global emissions of greenhouse gas methane soar to record high levels
item.description: Stanford University researchers and the Global Carbon Project assessed emissions from 2010 up until 2017, the last year complete data was available.

item.title: Burger King adds LEMONGRASS to its cows' diets in a bid to reduce their methane emissions
item.description: The company announced the news Tuesday, unveiling their Reduced Methane Emissions Beef Whopper, available select restaurants in Miami, New York, Portland, Austin and L.A.

item.title: NYT opinion writer Bari Weiss resigns with scathing letter
item.description: New York Times opinion writer Bari Weiss, who joined the paper three years ago, posted her resignation letter addressed to publisher A.G. Sulzberger on her website on Tuesday.

item.title: Heartstopping moment Michigan cop saves a three-week-old baby from choking as desperate mom looks on
item.description: Distressing footage shows the moment Officer Cameron Maciejewski arrived to a home in Sterling Heights Thursday night to find an infant girl not breathing.

item.title: Video of eagle rays near Florida goes viral due to sunburnt man
item.description: Video showing eagle rays swimming near a group of unsuspecting swimmers in Florida has gone viral after a badly sunburnt man appeared

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell breaks down in tears as she's DENIED bail
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, 58, was denied bail on Tuesday as a judge ruled she must stay locked up until her trial in July of 2021. She is being held at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

item.title: How to cover your face like a star as masks made compulsory
item.description: With face coverings to be compulsory in shops from next week and already mandatory on public transport, never has the need for masks been more vital.

item.title: CLIVE HAMILTON: UK must brace for Huawei backlash from China
item.description: In the eyes of the Chinese Communist Party, the decision to ban Huawei from the UK's 5G infrastructure means that this country has spectacularly failed that test of friendship.

item.title: Ulrika Jonsson says her selfie was 'antidote to celebrity fakery'
item.description: ULRIKA JONSSON: Looking at that selfie now, it isn't hard to imagine the sort of comments people will have made about it. Indeed, I'm sure they will have been instantly drawn to my deep mahogany tan.

item.title: Britons buy up holiday homes to cash in on the rise of staycations
item.description: Estate agents in rural hotspots are reporting a trebling in enquiries as properties are snapped up within minutes. The revival of the Great British Holiday means returns on holiday rentals could surge.

item.title: Spanish police arrest two men over murder of British pensioner
item.description: The pair, a 49-year-old Dutchman and a 33-year-old Spaniard, were held after a lengthy investigation into the 70-year-old's death during a violent robbery at her home south of Alicante.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Blackburn council tries to avoid tough lockdown
item.description: Civic chiefs in the Lancashire town are imposing new restrictions in a bid to prevent such measures as those put in place in Leicester following a Covid-19 outbreak in the Midlands city last month.

item.title: Barclays boss apologises for calling female city financier a 'tart'
item.description: Roger Jenkins (pictured outside the High Court, London) and Richard Boath, discussed Amanda Staveley during a telephone call in October 2008.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Masks were useless, now they're compulsory
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: If there's one phrase I'm sick of (spoken by Boris and Co in a serious tone) it's 'scientific advice'.

item.title: Coronavirus: Belgium has ZERO deaths for first time since March
item.description: The country, which has reined in the coronavirus after becoming the worst-hit mid-sized country in the world, reported no new coronavirus-related deaths in 24 hours for the first time since March 10.

item.title: 'Stretch' helper robot has arm to assist with household tasks
item.description: Stretch uses a robotic arm and gripper attached to a wheeled base and can be programmed for a number of household tasks like removing laundry from a dryer or operating a handheld vacuum.

item.title: Over 60 ducks saved from M25 after two-hour rescue mission
item.description: Around 60 ducks had to be rescued from Britain's busiest motorway on Sunday evening. The birds were seen waddling on the M25 motorway near Watford, Hertfordshire and took two hours to rescue.

item.title: Mass grave of 18 WWII Nazi paratroopers found in Poland
item.description: A mass grave containing the remains of 18 Nazi paratroopers, along with tools and weapons has been found in Poland. The soldiers died at the hands of Stalin's Red Army in 1945.

item.title: Tiger Woods applauds the Black Lives Matter movement as he prepares to return to golf action
item.description: DEREK LAWRENSON: Never the most political of animals, it's hard to imagine Woods following up with any grandiose gestures of support for the BLM movement before teeing off.

item.title: Tories cut up membership cards as party splits over face masks
item.description: The hashtag #NoMasks and the word 'muzzles' were both trending on Twitter while several Tory supporters posted pictures of chopped-up cards, cancelled registrations or deleting their direct debits.

item.title: Where to buy and how to make a face mask before July 24
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson's plan to make face masks mandatory in stores will see customers slapped with £100 fines if caught flouting the rules from July 24.

item.title: Cecil Rhodes statue on Table Mountain in Cape Town beheaded
item.description: The statue, which was on top of Cape Town's Table Mountain was damaged over the weekend, although nobody has taken responsibility for the attack. It is not the first time it was attacked.

item.title: What the UK's Huawei decision on 5G means for mobile services
item.description: Here's a look at the key issues that result from today's decision to ban Huawei 5G equipment, concerning the key players, customers and telecoms providers.

item.title: Belgian museums row over which mummy inspired TinTin story
item.description: Herge's fictional Inca has sparked a row between rival Belgian tourist attractions, each of which displays a mummy they say inspired Tintin's creator.

item.title: Carrie Symonds slams Amazon for too much plastic packaging
item.description: Carrie Symonds, 32, who lives at Downing Street with Boris Johnson and their son, said she was 'dismayed' at the amount of plastic packaging used by Amazon in their baby products.

item.title: Coronavirus: Blood clotting present in every patient who dies
item.description: Professor Graham Cooke, of Imperial College London, said post mortems 'showed very clearly' that every patient had some form of thrombosis - the formation of a blood clot in a vessel.

item.title: Fans swoon over Meghan Markle's flowing hair and glowing skin
item.description: Fans have praised Meghan Markle's appearance and remarked on her 'LA makeover' following her live speech for UN initiative Girl Up, which an expert has called her 'most important yet'.

item.title: Benjamin Keough recently left drug and alcohol rehab
item.description: Keough's girlfriend Diana Pinto was heard screaming 'Don't do it' to the 27-year-old in the moments leading up him shooting himself in the chest at Presley's luxury Calabasas, CA mansion.

item.title: Thames 'SHARK'? Bystanders share 'fin' photos on social media
item.description: This afternoon drop-jawed onlookers were convinced they had spotted a real one in the River Thames gliding past the Houses of Parliament in Westminster.

item.title: NASA's new Venus rover has FEELERS to keep it out of deep holes
item.description: NASA has unveiled a new rover design that could be used to help explore the surface of Venus, called the Venus Feeler, it has extended tri-wheel sensors designed to detect holes or rocks.

item.title: 'Urban canyons' can cause signal blackouts in driverless cars
item.description: 'Uurban canyons' caused by high-rise towers and skyscrapers on either side of a road can block signals received from satellites and result in 'potential safety and operational implications'.

item.title: Amber Heard's stylist says she 'never saw any marks or bruises'
item.description: Samantha McMillen, who has worked as Johnny Depp's stylist since 2002 and was Amber Heard's stylist during the couple's relationship, gave evidence in the actor's libel trial today.

item.title: Daisy Lowe kisses third lockdown love interest in London park
item.description: The model, 31, is refusing to let lockdown get in the way of her dating life and was pictured kissing a new mystery man while out with friends in the park on Saturday.

item.title: The Duchess of Cornwall reopens Wiltshire youth activity centre
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall, 72, thanked young carers for the 'brilliant job' they do, as she officially reopened the Youth Action Oxenwood Outdoor Activity near Marlborough in Wiltshire.

item.title: The Big One: Chances of major California earthquake TRIPLE
item.description: Scientists warn the risk of the 'Big One' hitting California's San Andreas fault have tripled after more than 3,000 earthquakes were recorded in the southern region last year.

item.title: Size 10 woman's doctor suggested weight loss without BMI check
item.description: Corrie Elizabeth, from Nottingham took to Twitter to reveal her GP told her to shed some pounds, due to the results of a blood test, without checking her weight. 'I'm a size 10 pushing size 12,' she said.

item.title: Video shows huge ships in head-on crash on Canadian canal
item.description: Disaster struck as the two vessels approached each other in the Welland Canal, a key shipping route that connects Lake Erie and Lake Ontario in Canada.

item.title: Dublin sadomasochism club raid found man 'strapped to crucifix'
item.description: During this week's proceedings, Mr Grant revealed how during an earlier police raid in Dublin in 2019, a Garda Inspector saw a man having his bottom whipped while strapped to a crucifix.

item.title: Adele impersonator to spend £11,000 on gastric bypass surgery
item.description: According to The Sun, twenty-stone Maria Herriott, 43, from London, is going under the knife to hopefully get more gigs after being told she looked more like the old voluptuous Adele.

item.title: Coronavirus: Skin rashes are a symptom for one in 11 patients
item.description: Researchers from King's College London drew on data from 20,000 Britons who either tested positive for Covid-19 or were heavily suspected of having the disease and never accessed a swab.

item.title: Britain records 138 more coronavirus deaths in preliminary toll
item.description: Department of Health chiefs have yet to confirm the final daily figure, which is often much higher because it takes into account lab-confirmed fatalities in all settings.

item.title: Workers at vegetable farm went to Primark and three supermarkets just days before 73 tested positive
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: One of the men was a vegetable picker who had tested positive before disappearing from Rook Row Farm at the height of the outbreak.

item.title: UK Government to issue advice on Do Not Resuscitate orders
item.description: Kate Masters had threatened to sue Matt Hancock and the UK Government over its failure to provide consistent advice on DNRs during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.media:credit: © Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Neighbours describe 'blood-curdling screams' when man in his 20s was hacked to death with a machete
item.description: The victim, named locally as Paulius Petrasiunas, was found bleeding in the front garden of a block of flats in Heath Town, Wolverhampton at 5.20pm yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths are up 46 percent across the US
item.description: More than 5,000 people died from COVID-19 between July 6 and July 12, which is an increase of 46 percent compared to the previous week.

item.title: Clive Tyldesley, 65, says he can't understand why he is being 'sacked' as ITV's voice of football
item.description: Legendary commentator Clive Tyldesley has revealed his dejection at being replaced in his lead role with ITV after 22 years in the job. He said he is baffled and upset by the decision.

item.title: Household Cavalry corporal sues MoD for £700k over eye injury
item.description: Simon Harley from Bordon, Hampshire, says he was erecting a tent during a training exercise in February 2015 when a bungee cord came loose suddenly and catapulted into his face.

item.title: Japan accuses China of spreading 'propaganda' and 'disinformation' during coronavirus pandemic
item.description: The 'disinformation' from China included online claims that the virus was brought to the country by a US military member and that Chinese herbal remedies could treat the disease, Japan claimed.

item.title: Bidding war breaks out over 12ft by 10ft BEACH HUT in Dorset
item.description: The wooden cabin at Mudeford Spit in Christchurch Harbour, Dorset, was listed for sale for the same asking price as a five bedroom detached house in Hull last Friday.

item.title: Woman, 60, claims she saw a radical improvement after 'neck-lift in a bottle' serum for two weeks
item.description: Retired Essex secretary Emma Greentree, 60, from Chelmsford, Essex, tried the Instant Effects Neck and Chest Rejuvenating Serum and says after two weeks she saw a radical difference.

item.title: Do YOU have a fortune in your attic? Experts reveal the valuable Nineties toys
item.description: Toys including Beanie Babies and Furbies have seen their value skyrocket in the decades since their release with some worth thousands, according to research by UK website Save The Student.

item.title: Ocado boss says 'the world has changed' and shoppers 'WON'T be going back' to rivals
item.description: Tim Steiner, founder of Ocado, has said the 'world as we know it has changed' for retailers since the coronavirus crisis struck as its sales in the first half of 2020 jumped up by 27 per cent.
